sen.j: ゆべし（柚餅子）とは、ユズを用いた加工食品のひとつ。
sen.e: Yubeshi (written as 柚餅子) is a processed food which is made using citron.
Yubeshi (written as 柚餅子) is a processed food which is made using citron.
Yubeshi (written as 柚餅子) is a processed food which is made using citron.

sen.j: 源平の時代に生まれたとも伝えられ、菓子というよりも保存食・携帯食に近いものであったとされ、時代と共に現在のようなお菓子へ変化したといわれている。
sen.e: It is said to have appeared during the Genpei period (late 11th century - late 12th century CE) as something more like a kind of preserved food or portable provisions rather than a confectionery, and have developed over time into a confectionery like the present day.

It is said to have appeared during the Genpei period (late 11th century - late 12th century CE) as something more like a kind of preserved food or portable provisions rather than a confectionery, and have developed over time into a confectionery like the present day.

sen.j: 現在では珍味に分類されるものと、和菓子で蒸し菓子の一種に分類されるものに分けられる。
sen.e: Today, it can be separated into those which are categorized under chinmi (food with a delicate flavor) and those which are categorized under a type of steamed cakes of Japanese confectioneries.
Today, it can be separated into those which are categorized under chinmi (food with a delicate flavor) and those which are categorized under a type of steamed cakes of Japanese confectioneries.

sen.j: ユズの上部を切り取った後、中身をくり抜き、この中に味噌、山椒、クルミなどを詰めて、切り取った上部で蓋をする。
sen.e: After the upper part of citron is cut away, the citron is hollowed and is stuffed with miso, Japanese pepper, walnut, and the like; then the upper part which was first cut away is placed on top as a lid.

After the upper part of citron is cut away, the citron is hollowed and is stuffed with miso, Japanese pepper, walnut, and the like; then the upper part which was first cut away is placed on top as a lid.

sen.j: そして、これをワラ等に巻いて日陰で一ヶ月～半年ほど乾燥させる。
sen.e: This is then wrapped with straw or the like to be dried in the shade for approximately one month to six months.
This is then wrapped with straw or the like to be dried in the shade for approximately one month to six months.
This is then wrapped with straw or the like to be dried in the shade for approximately one month to six months.

sen.j: 食べる際には、ワラを外して適宜に切り分け、酒の肴やご飯の副食物として用いる。
sen.e: When eating yubeshi, straw is removed, and yubeshi is cut into pieces appropriately to be served as an accompaniment to sake or a side dish for rice.
When eating yubeshi, straw is removed, and yubeshi is cut into pieces appropriately to be served as an accompaniment to sake or a side dish for rice.
When eating yubeshi, straw is removed, and yubeshi is cut into pieces appropriately to be served as an accompaniment to sake or a side dish for rice.

sen.j: 古来からある料理で、江戸時代の料理書『料理物語』には酒肴としてゆべしの製法が記されている。
sen.e: Yubeshi has existed since ancient times, and a process of making yubeshi as an accompaniment to sake is recorded in a cooking book titled "Ryori Monogatari" ("Tale of Food"), which was written in the Edo period.

sen.j: 現在でも、愛媛県松山市や奈良県十津川村などで製造されている。
sen.e: Even today, it is produced in places such as Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture and Totsukawa-mura, Nara Prefecture.
Even today, it is produced in places such as Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture and Totsukawa-mura, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: ユズの実の上部を切り取り、そこから中身をくり抜いて柚釜を作り、そこにユズの果肉、もち米粉、上新粉、白味噌、砂糖などを混ぜたものを入れて蒸したもの。
sen.e: An upper part of citron fruit is cut away and the fruit is hollowed to create a yuzu (citron) cup, into which a mixture of citron flesh, glutinous rice flour, rice powder, white bean paste, and sugar, etc. are stuffed, and then the yuzu cup is steamed.

An upper part of citron fruit is cut away and the fruit is hollowed to create a yuzu (citron) cup, into which a mixture of citron flesh, glutinous rice flour, rice powder, white bean paste, and sugar, etc. are stuffed, and then the yuzu cup is steamed.

An upper part of citron fruit is cut away and the fruit is hollowed to create a yuzu (citron) cup, into which a mixture of citron flesh, glutinous rice flour, rice powder, white bean paste, and sugar, etc. are stuffed, and then the yuzu cup is steamed.

sen.j: 蒸しと乾燥を20～30回、飴色になるまで繰り返す製法のため3～4ヶ月の期間を要する。
sen.e: Since the process of making yubeshi requires a repetition of steaming and drying for twenty to thirty times until the citron cup turns yellowish-brown, it takes a period of three to four months.
Since the process of making yubeshi requires a repetition of steaming and drying for twenty to thirty times until the citron cup turns yellowish-brown, it takes a period of three to four months.
Since the process of making yubeshi requires a repetition of steaming and drying for twenty to thirty times until the citron cup turns yellowish-brown, it takes a period of three to four months.

sen.j: （常温で比較的長期保存が可能なのは、この製法に起因する）
sen.e: (The reason which enables yubeshi to be stored for a relatively long period at room temperature is attributable to this process of making it) Furthermore, since the citron which is used for the yuzu cup must not have any damages and be of good quality, yubeshi is often served as luxurious chaka (a cake served with tea) at chaseki (tea ceremony seat).
(The reason which enables yubeshi to be stored for a relatively long period at room temperature is attributable to this process of making it.)

sen.j: また、柚釜に使用されるユズも傷のない、上質なものが必要とされるため、贅沢な茶菓として茶席で供される機会も多い。
sen.e: Furthermore, since the citron which is used for the yuzu cup must not have any damages and be of good quality, yubeshi is often served as luxurious chaka (a cake served with tea) at chaseki (tea ceremony seat).
sen.cmt: 文章単位を分割一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, since the citron which is used for the yuzu cup must not have any damages and be of good quality, yubeshi is often served as luxurious chaka (a cake served with tea) at chaseki (tea ceremony seat).

sen.j: 丸ゆべしの代表的な産地に石川県輪島市が有名になったのは、輪島塗の行商人が携行食として、また顧客への手土産として広まったとの説が有力である。
sen.e: According to a widely-accepted theory, Wajima City, Ishikawa Prefecture became famous as a typical production area of Maru Yubeshi because peddlers of wajima-nuri lacquerware carried it as portable food and also as a calling present to customers.

sen.j: ユズの皮を刻んだものともち米粉、上新粉、白味噌、醤油、砂糖などを混ぜて蒸し、竹の皮に包んだもの。
sen.e: A mixture of minced citron skin, glutinous rice flour, rice powder, white bean paste, soy sauce, and sugar, etc. is steamed and wrapped with a bamboo sheath.

sen.j: 棒ゆべしの産地には愛媛県西条市がある。
sen.e: Saijo City, Ehime Prefecture is a production area of Bo Yubeshi.
Saijo City, Ehime Prefecture is a production area of Bo Yubeshi.

sen.j: 求肥や羊羹にユズの香りをつけたものを「ゆべし」と称する場合もある。
sen.e: Sometimes gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from glutinous rice or glutinous rice flour) or yokan (azuki-bean jelly) flavored with citron is called "yubeshi".

sen.j: 仙台ゆべしなど、東北地方のゆべしにはユズが入っていない。
sen.e: Yubeshi in the Tohoku region such as Sendai Yubeshi does not contain citron.
Yubeshi in the Tohoku region such as Sendai Yubeshi does not contain citron.

sen.j: ユズの産地から距離があり、材料として使われにくかったからである。
sen.e: This is because Tohoku region was distant from the production area of citron, and thus it was difficult to use citron as an ingredient of yubeshi.

sen.j: また、クルミを入れるが、これはクルミが材料として入手しやすかったからである。
sen.e: Also, the reason for adding walnut is due to the fact that walnut was easily obtained as an ingredient.

sen.j: 味付けは醤油ベースであり、砂糖・黒砂糖の甘みにより、甘じょっぱいものになっている。
sen.e: Sendai yubeshi is flavored basically with soy sauce and has a sweet and salty taste because of the sweetness of sugar/muscovado sugar.

sen.j: 東北において、ゆべしは、本来のユズの菓子ではなく、餅菓子となっている。
sen.e: In the Tohoku region, yubeshi is regarded as a kind of rice cake sweets instead of the original citron confectionery.

sen.e: Yubeshi in Tohoku region can be largely divided into two types.

sen.j: 薬味として用いている。

sen.j: 製法は皮を薄く剥き、粉砕する。
sen.e: The process of making it is by thinly slicing the skin and breaking it into fragments.

sen.j: 醤油をくわえ極弱火で加熱し一時間煮、コンブの出汁と砂糖を加えさらに二時間。
sen.e: Soy sauce is added, and it is heated at an extremely low heat for one hour, and for additional two hours after kelp broth and sugar are added.

sen.j: 柚子の皮2kgに対し三温糖10kgと粗目(ザラメ)1～2kg。
sen.e: For two kilograms of citron skin, ten kilograms of soft brown sugar and one to two kilograms of granulated sugar are used.
For two kilograms of citron skin, ten kilograms of soft brown sugar and one to two kilograms of granulated sugar are used.

sen.j: 仕上げにトウガラシを入れて30分ほど煮て完成する。
sen.e: Red pepper is added last, and after boiling for about thirty minutes, the yubeshi is complete.
